Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the existence of a real panda seated in the business class section of a jetliner.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the viral image is genuine without providing any substantial proof.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests that the image may be fake or part of some type of act, casting doubt on its authenticity.
Contradict fact: The expert states that there is no record of a panda named Squee Squee in captivity, contradicting the claim's assertion of a real panda in the image.
Understate: The claim may understate the possibility of the image being fake or staged by presenting it as a factual representation.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not considering the endangered status of giant pandas and the monitoring of their whereabouts, which makes it unlikely for a panda to be traveling in the business class section of an airplane.
